name: Masala Dosa
description: A crispy rice and lentil crepe filled with spiced potato filling, served with chutney and sambar.
instructions: Soak rice and dal separately for 6 hours
Grind them together to make a smooth batter and ferment overnight
For filling: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves
Add onions and green chilies, saut√© until golden
Add turmeric and mashed potatoes, mix well and cook for 5 minutes
Heat a flat pan, pour a ladleful of batter and spread in circular motion
Drizzle oil around edges and cook until crispy
Place potato filling in the center and fold the dosa
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar

name: Idli
description: Soft, fluffy steamed rice cakes that are a staple South Indian breakfast item.
instructions: Soak rice and dal separately with fenugreek seeds for 6 hours
Grind dal to a smooth, fluffy batter
Grind rice to a slightly coarse batter
Mix both batters, add salt and ferment for 8-10 hours
Grease idli moulds with oil
Pour batter into moulds filling 3/4th
Steam for 12-15 minutes
Remove and serve hot with chutney and sambar

name: Sambar
description: A tangy lentil-based vegetable stew flavored with tamarind and sambar powder.
instructions: Cook toor dal with turmeric until soft and mash well
Soak tamarind in water and extract juice
Boil vegetables with salt until tender
Add tamarind juice, sambar powder, and cooked dal
Simmer for 10 minutes until flavors blend
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and let them splutter
Add asafoetida and curry leaves
Pour tempering over sambar and mix well
Serve hot with rice, idli, or dosa

name: Coconut Chutney
description: A creamy coconut-based condiment that pairs perfectly with dosas and idlis.
instructions: Grind coconut, green chilies, ginger, and roasted gram with water to smooth paste
Add salt and mix well
Heat oil in a small pan
Add mustard seeds and let them splutter
Add urad dal and curry leaves, fry until dal turns golden
Pour tempering over chutney and mix
Serve fresh with idli, dosa, or vada

name: Medu Vada
description: Crispy, savory lentil donuts that are deep-fried to golden perfection.
instructions: Soak urad dal for 4 hours and drain completely
Grind to a fluffy, coarse batter without adding much water
Add green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, pepper, asafoetida, and salt
Mix well in one direction to incorporate air
Heat oil for deep frying
Wet your hands, take a ball of batter, flatten and make a hole in center
Gently slide into hot oil
Fry until golden brown on both sides
Drain and serve hot with chutney and sambar

name: Rasam
description: A tangy, spicy soup made with tamarind, tomatoes, and rasam powder.
instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash well
Soak tamarind in water and extract juice
Boil tomatoes with tamarind juice until soft
Add rasam powder, salt, and cooked dal
Add 2 cups water and bring to boil
Crush cumin and pepper coarsely
Heat ghee, add mustard seeds, dry chilies, and curry leaves
Add crushed cumin-pepper, garlic, and asafoetida
Pour tempering into rasam, add coriander leaves
Serve hot with rice or drink as soup

name: Bisi Bele Bath
description: A flavorful one-pot meal from Karnataka made with rice, lentils, vegetables, and special spice blend.
instructions: Cook rice and dal together until soft
Cook mixed vegetables separately
Extract tamarind juice and add to cooked rice-dal mixture
Add vegetables, tomatoes, and bisi bele bath powder
Add salt and simmer for 15 minutes
Heat ghee, fry cashews until golden and set aside
In same ghee, add mustard seeds, dry chilies, and curry leaves
Pour tempering over the bisi bele bath
Garnish with fried cashews
Serve hot with papad and raita

name: Pongal
description: A comforting rice and lentil porridge tempered with ghee, pepper, and cumin.
instructions: Dry roast moong dal until aromatic
Cook rice and roasted dal together with water until very soft and mushy
Mash well and add salt
Coarsely crush pepper and cumin
Heat ghee, fry cashews until golden
Add crushed pepper-cumin, dry chilies, and curry leaves
Add grated ginger and fry for a minute
Pour this tempering over pongal and mix well
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar

name: Upma
description: A savory semolina breakfast dish flavored with vegetables and aromatic spices.
instructions: Dry roast rava until aromatic and set aside
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, chana dal, and urad dal
When dals turn golden, add cashews and fry
Add green chilies, ginger, and curry leaves
Add onions and saut√© until translucent
Add vegetables and saut√© for 3 minutes
Add 2.5 cups water and salt, bring to boil
Slowly add roasted rava while stirring continuously
Cook for 5 minutes on low flame, stirring occasionally
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot

name: Lemon Rice
description: Tangy and flavorful rice dish tempered with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and peanuts.
instructions: Cook rice and let it cool completely
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and let them splutter
Add chana dal, urad dal, and peanuts, fry until golden
Add green chilies and curry leaves
Add turmeric and asafoetida
Turn off heat and add cooked rice
Mix gently to coat rice with tempering
Add lemon juice and salt, mix well
Garnish with coriander leaves
Serve with papad or potato chips
